body_html:
Work-around

setattr(tf.GraphKeys, "VARIABLES", "variables")

The reason this warning happens is because graph_editor programmatically scans all values in GraphKeys and each time you access tf.GraphKeys.VARIABLES, it issues a warning.

I think this is more a problem of how deprecation warnings are generated, rather than an issue with graph editor relying on deprecated API

I think this is more a problem of how deprecation warnings are generated, rather than an issue with graph editor relying on deprecated API
body:
Work-around

`setattr(tf.GraphKeys, "VARIABLES", "variables")`

The reason this warning happens is because graph_editor programmatically scans all values in GraphKeys and each time you access tf.GraphKeys.VARIABLES, it issues a warning.

I think this is more a problem of how deprecation warnings are generated, rather than an issue with graph editor relying on deprecated API
